Util::APArray< Data > Class Template Reference
Pointer Arrays

Detailed Description

template<typename Data>
class Util::APArray< Data >

Automatically resizable PArray.

An APArray is a PArray that grows as needed as objects are appended. Like any PArray, it holds pointers to objects, rather than objects. The associated objects are not destroyed when a PArray is deallocated or destroyed.

template<typename Data >
Util::APArray< Data >::~APArray ( ) [inline, virtual]

Destructor.

Deletes array of pointers, if allocated previously. Does not delete the associated Data objects.

Assignment, element by element.

template<typename Data >
void Util::APArray< Data >::reserve ( int  capacity)

Reserve memory for specified number of elements.

Resizes and copies array if requested capacity is less than the current capacity. Does nothing if requested capacity is greater than current capacity.

Parameters:
capacitynumber of elements for which to reserve space.
